sense.name: force to leave a position of power, job, place or competition
sense.examples: The president was ousted in a military coup in January 1987. Police are trying to oust drug dealers from the city centre. The champions were defeated by Arsenal and ousted from the League Cup. The chairman was ousted after he misappropriated funds.

sense.name: remove and replace, take the place of
sense.examples: It would seem that the computer has ousted some actual students. The word processor has ousted the typewriter.
